text.0:
#COVID19 has highlighted the urgent need for strong #PrimaryHealthCare:hospital: that can provide essential services within the community - when and where people need it.
 
https://t.co/SvuCBKBLnI
text.1:
How can grandparents spend time with their children during #COVID19? 

#WorldChildrensDay 

https://t.co/8DPbYVLJcr
text.2: There's no vaccine for #ClimateChange, poverty and inequalities, so we need to heal the world by forging a new era of cooperation, which puts health and well-being at the centre of our children's future. #WorldChildrensDay https://t.co/UyI0VgLX4A
text.3: Violence, #ClimateChange, alcohol, tobacco & the internet... are a few of the many threats we need to protect our children from to ensure them a healthier future. #COVID19 has exacerbated the risks they pose, showing we can't go back to business as usual. https://t.co/5plLgnDpCe
text.4: Today is #WorldChildrensDay. Although children are less at risk from severe #COVID19, children have suffered from the pandemic in many ways. That makes it even more important to fight it with every tool at our disposal – to save lives now & give our children a better future.
text.5:
.@DrMikeRyan  answering a question about whether it is safe for children to go back to school :backhand_index_pointing_down: 

#COVID19  #WorldChildrensDay  

https://t.co/yXwLQG4hJh
text.6:
The group will harness the leadership & influence of its world-renowned members to catalyze global attention & action to preserve antimicrobial medicines and avert the disastrous consequences of #AntimicrobialResistance.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/6niBbEUlKF https://t.co/NP6oWLo35U
text.7:
World leaders are joining forces to fight the accelerating crisis of #AntimicrobialResistance. The :NEW_button: One Health Global Leaders Group launched today includes heads of government, ministers, leaders from the private sector & civil society.
 
:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/jRdGt6EtzY https://t.co/al1sQJ7EWX
text.8:
"I want to grow up in a healthy environment"
"I want to grow in a world that's healthy, clean & without pollution"
 
That's the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:children want to see.
 
Are we building the future they want and deserve?
 
#WorldChildrensDay 

https://t.co/3GdauCCnsr
text.10:
What do children need to be protected from?

Here’s what they see as the major threats to their health, futures, and wellbeing:backhand_index_pointing_down:

#HealthForAll  #WorldChildrensDay

https://t.co/ci9bYMQGw2
text.11: "Our response to the pandemic, & the way we recover from it, will shape the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: our children grow up in. That makes it even more important to fight #COVID19with every tool at our disposal – to save lives now & give our children a better future"-@DrTedros #WorldChildrensDay
text.12:
"Today is #WorldChildrensDay. As our colleagues at @UNICEF say, it’s a day to reimagine a better future for every child.

Although children are less at risk from severe #COVID19 disease, children have suffered from the pandemic in many ways"-@DrTedros
text.13:
Corticosteroids are the only drug so far proven to be effective against #COVID19, when used in the treatment of severe and critical patients.

https://t.co/eWHzRrYKvO
text.14:
This does not rule out an intervention’s benefit, instead, it means that there isn’t enough evidence to support the use of remdesivir for #COVID19. 

https://t.co/h3IG0zJf2H
text.15:
A conditional recommendation is issued when the evidence around the benefits and risks of an intervention is less certain. In this case, there is a conditional recommendation against the use of remdesivir for #COVID19 at present. 
 
:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/UcCqXW1E6g https://t.co/gHTY3agFVj
text.16:
:NEW_button:WHO has made a conditional recommendation against the use of remdesivir in hospitalized #COVID19 patients, as there is currently no evidence that remdesivir improves survival or reduces need for ventilation in these patients.
 
:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/UcCqXW1E6g https://t.co/xMRVY94d8R
text.17: "The Group will bring together key stakeholders in agriculture, health, development, food & feed production & other relevant areas to maintain urgency, public support, political momentum & visibility of the #antimicrobialresistance challenge"-@DrTedros
text.18:
"The Group will be co-chaired by Her Excellency Sheikh Hasina, Prime Minister of #Bangladesh, and Her Excellency @miaamormottley, Prime Minister of #Barbados.

https://t.co/OLhjHSqFvi https://t.co/vqeMHQV1Hz
text.19: "That’s why today we are launching the One Health Global Leaders Group, which will bring together prominent leaders from government, the private sector and civil society organizations, to advocate for urgent action to combat the threat of #antimicrobialresistance"-@DrTedros
text.20:
"Together, our three organizations will work to address these gaps and generate more global coherence in the use of antimicrobials.

One of the most important ways to do that is through increased political commitment at the highest levels of government"-@DrTedros
text.21: "Today the tripartite is launching a new report that examines the international instruments that govern the use of antimicrobials – and identifies gaps in regulations for use of antimicrobials in humans, animals and plants"-@DrTedros https://t.co/3yp77Cmvou
text.22: "Thanks to the governments of the :Netherlands:, :Sweden: & :United_Kingdom:, to date we have raised $13M, which will provide the first round of support to eleven countries. Just this week we have launched the implementation in :Indonesia:. Additional funds will be required for the next round of investment"-@DrTedros
text.23: "To help address that gap, together we have established a trust fund to support low- and middle-income countries to develop a truly One Health approach to addressing #antimicrobialresistance"-@DrTedros
text.24: "Our 3 organizations conduct regular surveys to monitor country progress on #antimicrobialresistance. Our latest report shows that almost 90% of countries have national action plans for antimicrobial resistance, but only 20% have identified funding for implementation"-@DrTedros
text.25: "For years, WHO has been working with the @FAO, and the @OIEAnimalHealth, to address #antimicrobialresistance and other health issues that arise from the interaction between humans and animals with a “One Health” approach"-@DrTedros #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek
text.26:
"The slogan for 2020 is "Antimicrobials: handle with care"."-@DrTedros #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek 

https://t.co/RI07ga51UQ
text.27: "Wednesday marked the start of #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek, an annual opportunity to raise awareness of #antimicrobialresistance & encourage best practices among the general public, :man_health_worker_selector::woman_health_worker_selector: & policy makers to slow the development & spread of drug-resistant infections"-@DrTedros
text.28: "Although antibiotics are a key focus, antimicrobial resistance also includes resistance to medicines for HIV, malaria, neglected tropical diseases and more"-@DrTedros #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek
text.29:
#AntimicrobialResistance may not seem as urgent as a pandemic, but it is just as dangerous.

It threatens to unwind a century of medical progress and leave us defenceless against infections that today can be treated easily"-@DrTedros #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek
text.30:
"That is nowhere more true than in the case of #antimicrobialresistance – one of the greatest health threats of our time"-@DrTedros #WorldAntimicrobialAwarenessWeek 

https://t.co/S910MtChjk
text.31:
"The #COVID19 pandemic is a stark reminder of the intimate relationship between humans, animals and the planet we share.

We cannot protect and promote human health without paying attention to the health of animals and the health of our environment"-@DrTedros
text.32: "This week there has been more good news from vaccine trials, which continues to give us hope of ending the #COVID19 pandemic. At the same time, we must continue to use the tools we have to interrupt the chains of transmission and save lives now"-@DrTedros
text.33:
"More cases of #COVID19 have been reported in the past 4 weeks than in the first six months of the pandemic.

Across Europe and North America, hospitals and intensive care Units units are filling up or full"-@DrTedros
text.35: From birth to the last days of your life, trusted #PrimaryHealthCare:hospital: providers are by your side, helping you make the best decisions for the your health and the health of your family :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/5tGt0v2i3R #HealthForAll https://t.co/CB3mEQuCzI
text.36:
Exploitative marketing exposes children to harmful products:

:beverage_box:Sugary drinks
:lollipop:Sweets
:french_fries:Fast food
:cigarette:Tobacco
:wine_glass:Alcohol
:video_game:Gaming

Children must be protected :backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/VYUOGGVeP3
 
#HealthForAll #WorldChildrensDay 
 
https://t.co/eO6ndJBV9Z
text.37:
Today is #WorldChildrensDay 

Here is some helpful advice on how to talk to children about #COVID19 :backhand_index_pointing_down: https://t.co/ERCNVEmRMr
text.38:
#Ukraine:Ukraine: demonstrates how investing in health systems can boost its #COVID19 response and accelerate progress towards #HealthForAll :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/Ud6xhpRNdQ 

https://t.co/M7aBmpMdFX
text.39:
Children around the :globe_showing_Americas: are speaking out for their health and rights. :loudspeaker:It’s time to listen to what they have to say.
 
Are we building a future fit for them? :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/VYUOGGVeP3
 
 #HealthForAll #WorldChildrensDay 

https://t.co/6H5o93O7PF
text.40:
To protect children, leaders must
 
:small_blue_diamond:Invest in children
:small_blue_diamond:Ensure children’s voices are heard
:small_blue_diamond:Reduce carbon emissions now
:small_blue_diamond:Regulate harmful marketing

:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/4ZuzZtr3lZ
 
#HealthForAll #WorldChildrensDay https://t.co/7oSaL280nZ
text.41:
On #WorldChildrensDay these little ones are telling YOU how they imagine the :globe_showing_Americas:will look like in :keycap_digit_one: :keycap_digit_zero::keycap_digit_zero: years' time.
 
Here’s what they say :backhand_index_pointing_down:

https://t.co/WgR6TgjMoY
text.42:
Tip to prevent #AntimicrobialResistance :keycap_digit_two::
Continue your required treatments even during #COVID19.
 
Let's unite to prevent drug resistance!

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/z3xcHtkUz8 https://t.co/MUFRgM8RC9
text.43:
Vaccines save lives. 

Where it is safe and feasible, we must ensure children continue to get immunized during the #COVID19 pandemic to protect them from other deadly diseases like meningitis. 

#WorldChildrensDay  #VaccinesWork 

https://t.co/zOautor9VK
text.44:
Climate change leaves children at risk from

:small_orange_diamond:Extreme weather
:small_orange_diamond:Flooding
:small_orange_diamond:Drought
:small_orange_diamond:Rising food prices and shortages
:small_orange_diamond: Rapid disease spread
 
A healthy child needs a clean & healthy planet to live in.

:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/4ZuzZtr3lZ

#HealthForAll #WorldChildrensDay https://t.co/VWF7Z58MbW
text.45:
Risks to a child’s health are all around us, from
 
:red_circle: A rapidly changing climate
:red_circle: Polluted air
:red_circle: Harmful marketing
:red_circle: Displacement
:red_circle: Conflict
:red_circle: Inequality
 
Every child deserves a healthy life :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/VYUOGGVeP3
 
#HealthForAll  #WorldChildrensDay https://t.co/YcXYDOb6J7
text.46:
For more information on vaccine safety, check WHO Q&A :down_arrow_selector:
https://t.co/HIGtj0VAPk
text.47:
Developing safe and effective #COVID19 vaccines is a huge step forward. Then the next challenge will be to deploy vaccines across the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: to all the vulnerable and high-risk groups at the same time.

A vaccine will not stop the pandemic, vaccination will. #ACTogether
text.48:
#COVID19 vaccines - will they be safe? 
@Kate_L_OBrien explains why we can trust the safety of COVID-19 vaccines trials :down_arrow_selector: https://t.co/mU7oEA63Iq
text.49:
It's World Antimicrobial Awareness Week. 
 
Tip to prevent #AntimicrobialResistance :keycap_digit_one::
Wash your hands! Proper :raising_hands: hygiene prevents infections & slows the spread of #AntibioticResistance.
 
Let's unite to prevent drug resistance!
 
:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/z3xcHtkUz8 https://t.co/emPO2X7YKj
text.50:
No country is adequately protecting children’s 
•health 
•their environment, and
•their futures 
 
On #WorldChildrensDay and every day, we must build a future fit for children.

:backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/4ZuzZtr3lZ

https://t.co/qhxQ1HTIUL
